record.title: ORDER FOR RECESS AND ORDERS FOR WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 24, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate now stand in recess until 8:30 p.m. this evening and that at 8:40 p.m., Members then proceed as a body to the House of Representatives for the State of the Union Address; that upon the conclusion of the address, the Senate then stand adjourned until 9:30 a.m., Wednesday, January 24; that on Wednesday, following the prayer and pledge, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period for the transaction of morning business until 10:30 a.m., with the time equally divided and controlled between the majority and Republican leaders or their designees, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each; that the majority control the first half and the Republicans the second

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
